page.title: 06MANOR FARM, WALL.
page.content: The Manor and Pipeplace Farms comprise 700 arable acres of light sand on the bank changing to black peat in the valley through which runs a small stream. This provides the water for an extensive irrigation system which covers the whole farm by means of an electrically powered pump and underground mains. The crops grown are potatoes, sugar beet, wheat and barley - the latter being fed to the Wall herd of pedigree Large White pigs founded in 1917 some of which are sold for breeding and the remainder for bacon. The fields are large each being 80-100 acres and where hedges have been removed to ease mechanisation a number of spinneys have been planted with various hardwood trees. Two pools have been dug out fed by spring water, here fish and wildlife flourish. The farm is worked by 6 men and is very mechanised.
